concept.title: Creating a Program From Existing Program

othermeta.name: title
othermeta.content: Creating a Program From Existing Program

othermeta.name: shortdesc
othermeta.content: Analysts can create a new program by copying an existing program's configuration using Create From, then modify dates and settings before saving.

othermeta.name: usecase
othermeta.content: create new programs efficiently by cloning and modifying existing programs

conbody.p: Creating a Program From Existing Program is another action available to analysts, to create a new program based on an existing program on the agreement when it is amended.

The analyst can select a program within the agreement and click Create From to clone it, or the analyst can click Create From and search for a program. The following fields are displayed in the search results.

ul.li: Original Program ID: ID of the original program
Program Name: Name of the program
Version Number: Version number of the program
New Program Name: Name of the new program
New Start Date: Start date of the program
New End Date: End date of the program
Agreement Id: ID of the agreement
Agreement Name: Name of the agreement
Agreement Status: Status of the agreement

conbody.p: The search filter enables the user to enter part of the name or ID to view the results.
To create a program from an existing program, perform the following steps:

ol.li: By default, the selected program's start and end date are displayed. Click icon to change the Start Date and End Date. Select Copy products and participants with end dates greater than or equal to today's date checkbox to consider today's date for the New Start Date of the program and copy all sections, qualifications & benefits within the section, and participants that fall within the date range.
Click Apply.The copied program is added to the agreement.
